| Incentive type | Typical amount/value | Why it’s used |

**What the evidence says about the size of the incentive:**  
A 2022 cost‑effectiveness analysis (Cook & Ludwig, *Health Affairs*) found that, on average, a city spends **≈ $1,500 per firearm collected** when you include staff time, advertising, and the cash payout. | Message theme | Typical wording | Psychological mechanism |
|---------------|----------------|--------------------------|
| **Safety & Prevention** | “Turn in a gun, keep your family safe.” | *Loss aversion*: Emphasizes the fear of a loved one being harmed. |
